resources.string: By touching the start button, Net Monitor starts a passive service which detects all active network connections. A background notification will inform you of the ongoing monitoring.
Net Monitor service has been started in passive mode.
Net Monitor service has been stopped. Was in passive mode.

string.name: report_detail_ssllabs
string.u: Open SSL Labs Server Test Results

resources.string: This app belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Technische Universität Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images Copyright Technische Universität Darmstadt und Google Inc.
More information can be found on:
This app uses Java-SSLLabs-API by Björn Roland and Qualys SSL Labs.
What is Privacy Friendly Net Monitor?
Privacy Friendly Net Monitor monitors network traffic from installed apps. It scans active network connections with a background service and also displays additional network encryption information.

Net Monitor deploys an background service, which scans for active connections every second. Apps invoking the detected connections are identified and listed with remote addresses they are communicating with.
What is protocol and encryption detection?

Based on a connection\'s remote port, the transport protocol can be identified by "Well Known Port" tables. Based on the known ports, a warning is given in case a connection is known for not being encrypted. Note, that this is no grantee that the connection uses this protocol, since assignment of port numbers is not enforced by the system.

The remote host name assigned is requested by reverse name resolution. This is done asynchronously in background and thus may take some seconds. Remark: The resolved hostname may not be the actual domain name requested by e.g. a browser app.
A detailed mode can be switched on in the settings. After activation additional technical information of scanned connections is displayed after a connection has been touched in the overview.

An automatic analysis of the remote servers TLS implementation can be activated in the settings. When active, remote servers with a resolved hostname are tested automatically when the connection protocol is known for using TLS encryption. The analysis is performed by SSL Labs API and the associated service. The remote server\'s implementation quality is shown in grades A+ (best) to F (worst), or is displayed as T (trust issues). For further information on SSL Lab API see the About.

Privacy Friendly Net Monitor does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisement and comes free of charge. It is published under GPLv3 license and is free to distribute. The information on network connections is not stored.

Privacy Friendly Net Monitor does not require any permission for scanning active connections. The Certificate Validation feature requires the Internet permission to request server test results from Qualys SSL Labs.

The [System] tag identifies an app pre-installed on the android system by the original equipment manufacturer (OEM). If the app is named \'System [System]\', an android system component itself has invoked the connection (root-user).

SSL-Labs API from Qualys performs a deep analysis of SSL/TLS web server. Net Monitor requests analysis results on demand from SSL Labs. SSL-Labs privacy terms state, that it does not share submitted IP addresses or hostnames with any third party.
What are the meanings of unencrypted and encrypted ports in the detail view?

In fact the ports are not unencrypted or encrypted. But a port is handling all the traffic of one service. This services communicates over a unencrypted or encrypted protocol. If an "port is encrypted" it means that the service, that communicates over this port, is using an encrypted protocol (vise versa for unencrypted).
Show info tab when touching a connection.
Perform analysis with SSL Labs API.
Highlights the connections in green and red.
Privacy Friendly Net Monitor shows the network activity of installed apps. Use it to check on all your device\'s connections.
Currently active connections and encryption info is listed by app. \n Logging, detailed technical info, and server validation features can be activated in settings.
Privacy Friendly Net Monitor can store a connection history of chosen apps. The connection history is displayed as a list and as a graph (via a long press).

No reports available.
